title: What is the difference between a case study and a white paper? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m glad that this is a question that I have researched well. What is a white paper? White papers are great examples of marketing collateral that exhibit your authority over a chosen niche. Essentially, they are long-form content intended to educate the target audience, that delve deeper into a particular industry trend/issue, explain the causes behind it, its implications/benefits, and ways to remedy it. According to the B2B Content Marketing 2018 Benchmarks, Budgets, and Trends report, white papers emerged as one of the top 4 most effective types of marketing collateral that companies use with 71% companies preferring it. White papers are created to showcase a company’s their target audience their domain authority in a topic. Typical uses of a white paper are: Educating the audienceLooking under the wraps of newer trends in the marketplacePredicting the future of an industryExpanding your brand presenceGetting inbound traffic at the top of your funnelGenerating leads for your businessIncrease the top line for your companyWhat is a case study? Case studies are short-form content that explain a specific instance of how a customer problem was addressed. It begins with a problem statement, the solution to it and the benefits realized. In fact, a case study can be a part of a white paper. When you are dealing with a broad topic in white papers, a case study can be used to explain how your methodology was implemented. Here are The Best White Paper Examples For B2B Marketers and how the biggest companies are hitting the ball out of the park with them. Moreover, if you are looking for white paper templates, here are free templates including a guide to writing awesome white papers.

If we go by exact words “ CASE STUDY”, it means a study of the particular case. How certain things were done, a process, details, etc. about the project. WHITEPAPER is a copy which contains information about the product or services.
